comment: Dr. Z is an awesome professor! Attend lectures, stay off your phones and do your assignments and you'll have no problem earning an "A". I loved his teaching style, although he does try to be offensive which isn't for everyone. Overall, great professor and I definitely recommend!

Dr. Z is a great professor. I made an A but I had to work for it. DO ALL HOMEWORK ASSIGNMENTS AND THE EXTRA CREDIT. Brought my  final grade up by 10 points. He really does care about his students and will talk to you about any problems you have. Get a study group! I was one who thought I had never been in one and I wouldnt need to but you need to.
I hate this guy so much. He can really get on a person's nerves.

Claims students should "RTFS" but half the information is incorrect on it. Quiz information chosen at random, anything goes. Good luck studying, which he claims you should do 8 hours a day. Very liberal in the grading process. Extremely difficult to learn from, due to attitude.

Mr. Z is a great teacher. He really does care about his students even though he pretends not to. He is funny, but curses a ton which was I did not appreciate. Put the work in though, and you will do well in his class. Must have the textbook to pass.

Mr. Z is really awesome, if you go to class it is worth it. First of all, ALL assignments and tests are online.. so you know what that means. Get into "study groups" the day of the test and you'll get an A. He also requires weekly section questions on one chapter a week, very easy takes no time at all. He doesn't ever take attendance either, ever.

This class will certainly challenge you. The exams are hard, but if you do the chapter assignments and extra credit work, you can pull a good grade! He's got a good sense of humor and is very helpful; you just have to ask him for help. I don't have a problem with him not answering emails... Just don't use D2L.

Genuinely cares about his students. Not just their performance in his class but their overall educational experience. I will say that his quizzes are murder, but it's not hard to do well on the assignments and exams. Getting an A isn't too difficult and a B is basically guaranteed.

I love Mr. Z! He knows so much and tells interesting stories about clients. His exams are online and he posts his PowerPoints on D2L. Sometimes uses harsh language, but he's funny and engaging. Great class!

He is very bad at responding to e-mails and rarely checks D2L (other than updating grades). He gives pop quizzes on the the book almost weekly so make sure you read throughly. He swears like no one I've ever met so if you're easily offended, don't take the class. Also- very biased and goes through the slides quickly. He has ruined the class for me.

A very interesting person and really knows his stuff. Is very unhelpful. Rarely answers emails, and instructions for homework or tests are very unclear. Tests are online but very hard, weekly pop quizzes on material we havent started yet, goes through power points very quickly but then lets class out 40 min early. Not AWFUL, but not good.

Mr. Z is an interesting teacher. He is thorough and requires you to be thorough while reading the text book. His exams are as hell but are online and multiple choice. There are weekly pop quizzes. He uses a buttload of language and can be kind of offensive. I like his class.

We had a bumpy start to our class. However, it had nothing to do with the teacher.I thought that he was fairly easy. I read the book and went to every class. We did a group project which I don't really care for. But it was easy and we got an A. I made a high A in the class. As long as you do the work and care about school you should do just fine.
Did not like him as a teacher or person. and don't know why hes considered hot. was very disappointed the first day of class.

if you like hearing opinions that can be rude/offensive this could be your teacher. He was also not helpful what so ever when I needed to email him and was also rude when he replied or just didn't answer. Very confident in himself in an annoying way. I did not enjoy the class to say the least. it started off well and then went straight down hill.

If you want an interesting professor & class..take Mr. Z.Attendance is mandatory because most of his exams (online) come from in class lecture.Read the text BEFORE coming to class, participate in discussion & challenge him..you'll be fine! Handful of easy discussions & 2 article summaries..READ HIS GUIDELINES/SYLLABUS & you will get along with him.

Class was interesting. Attendance is required due to daily quizzes that are pretty difficult. To pass, you must read the book thoroughly. The teacher was great, our tests were online. Only problem I had was the clarity. Rubrics were rarely given and everyone was confused all of the time.

Wouldn't be my first choice if I was able to pick another teacher. He's not horrible to listen to because he does try to make the class lively, but assignments/due dates/ class schedules aren't clear and it makes it hard to ensure that you're where you need to be. There's two papers and a project that are a pain as well as quizzes and two tests.

I attended the Drug & Alcohol Abuse Class under the Counseling & Human Development major. Zimmermann made the class interesting, related well to the students, had great projects & out of class research requirements, and was overall an absolute BA teacher. Very well informed in the psychology field! Highly suggest you take any class he offers.
Mr. Zimmerman was a really nice, easy-going teacher. Just make sure you read the book and keep up with what he wants. As long as you do the work, you should make an A.

He is an interesting teacher and tries to find a way to make the material interesting. You need to read the textbook, and make sure to attend class. I would highly recommend his class, though. He is an engaging teacher.
